meanings.definition: a unit of digital information equivalent to one billion bytes
meanings.sent1: My new computer has a hard drive with a gigabyte of storage space.
meanings.sent2: I need a gigabyte USB drive to store all my photos.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally tried to fit a gigabyte of data on a floppy disk!
meanings.sent4: Her brain processed information like a gigabyte, quickly and efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The gigabyte of memory was enough to hold the entire encyclopedia.

meanings.definition: a storage capacity of one billion bytes
meanings.sent1: The external hard drive has a gigabyte of space for all your files.
meanings.sent2: I downloaded a movie that required a gigabyte of free space on my computer.
meanings.sent3: I joked that a gigabyte of cookies would last me a lifetime.
meanings.sent4: His backpack seemed to have a gigabyte of snacks hidden inside.
meanings.sent5: The gigabyte of storage was enough for all the music albums.

meanings.definition: a measurement of computer memory or storage capacity
meanings.sent1: The new laptop boasts a gigabyte of RAM for faster performance.
meanings.sent2: The software update required at least a gigabyte of free memory.
meanings.sent3: I compared my brain to a gigabyte, always full of random facts.
meanings.sent4: The gigabyte of knowledge in the book was truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: The gigabyte of memory allowed for seamless multitasking.
